title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 Point

  • 1 point: Perfect competition (or pure competition) since price of output is given to the firm.

"Because the firm is a price-taker" is also acceptable.
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

  • 1 point: Perfect competition (or pure competition) since price of output is given to the firm.

"Because the firm is a price-taker" is also acceptable.

The student earns all of the following points:

  • 1 point: Perfect competition (or pure competition) since price of output is given to the firm.

"Because the firm is a price-taker" is also acceptable.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 Point

  • 1 point: Perfect competition since the wage rate is given to the firm.

"Because the firm is a price-taker" is also acceptable.
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

  • 1 point: Perfect competition since the wage rate is given to the firm.


"Because the firm is a price-taker" is also acceptable.

The student earns all of the following points:

  • 1 point: Perfect competition since the wage rate is given to the firm.

"Because the firm is a price-taker" is also acceptable.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
2 Points

  • 1 point: for 5 workers

  • 1 point: for the explanation

The MRP>w for 5 workers but not for 6.

It is not sufficient to point out that the firm earns a profit (or its greater profit) at 5 workers. Some reference must be made to the fact that MRC (MRC, MC of labor, or wages) is closest to MRP and is still greater than MRP at that level output.
descriptions:

  • 1 point: for 5 workers

  • 1 point: for the explanation

It is not sufficient to point out that the firm earns a profit (or its greater profit) at 5 workers. Some reference must be made to the fact that MRC (MRC, MC of labor, or wages) is closest to MRP and is still greater than MRP at that level output.

The student earns one of the following points:

  • 1 point: for 5 workers

  • 1 point: for the explanation

The MRP>w for 5 workers but not for 6.

It is not sufficient to point out that the firm earns a profit (or its greater profit) at 5 workers. Some reference must be made to the fact that MRC (MRC, MC of labor, or wages) is closest to MRP and is still greater than MRP at that level output.

The student earns all of the following points:

  • 1 point: for 5 workers

  • 1 point: for the explanation

The MRP>w for 5 workers but not for 6.

It is not sufficient to point out that the firm earns a profit (or its greater profit) at 5 workers. Some reference must be made to the fact that MRC (MRC, MC of labor, or wages) is closest to MRP and is still greater than MRP at that level output.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 Point

  • 1 point: 46 units of output

The output level must be consistent with the units of labor selected in part (c) may still earn the point here if the output level is consistent with that quantity of labor indicated by the student in part (c).
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

  • 1 point: 46 units of output

The output level must be consistent with the units of labor selected in part (c) may still earn the point here if the output level is consistent with that quantity of labor indicated by the student in part (c).

The student earns all of the following points:

  • 1 point: 46 units of output

The output level must be consistent with the units of labor selected in part (c) may still earn the point here if the output level is consistent with that quantity of labor indicated by the student in part (c).

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
1 point:

TR: $138 (46 x $3)

-TVC 55 (5 x $11)

-TFC 10

=Economic Profit $73

Must be consistent with the student's answer above.

They do not have to show the actual profit. If they state that a profit is being earned because TR > TC, they receive credit.
